body.p: Python supports a variety of numbers, including integers, floats, and complex numbers. Python includes built-in numeric types to represent numbers. You can convert between different types using casting. Casting allows you to convert between different numeric types, such as converting an integer to a float or vice versa.

section.title: Example
section.codeblock: # Example of numbers and casting x = 10 # Integer y = 3.14 # Float z = complex(1, 2) # Complex number
